metadata.titel_preek: One Exorcism, One Earthquake, One Baptism . . . and Joy

locutie.beschrijving: A narrative retelling of three episodes in Acts 16 (exorcism, imprisonment, earthquake/baptism) framed by the liturgical calendar (Easter, Ascension, Pentecost).
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong thematic exegesis; focuses on the socio-economic and psychological dimensions of the text.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the meaning of the text and describing the power of Jesus, with a late shift toward invitation.
voorbeelden: The good news is that the crucified/risen one lets us be our true selves.
To enact the freedom of Jesus in the real world upsets settled social arrangements.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To make the hearer recognize their own 'possessions' or 'prisons' and desire the freedom of Jesus.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentions Pentecost and the Spirit as the power for new obedience, though the sermon's own delivery relies heavily on narrative logic.

voorbeelden: This is a Sunday when all these matters converge.
The slave girl is not wicked, but she is possessed.
The narrator does not say so, but surely the earthquake was the work of the Easter God.
I imagine the lectionary committee sitting...
I know that this story has nothing to do with you.
It is no wonder that we have Psalm 97.
The good news given in this strange narrative is that the name... let us become our true selves.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The 'promises' are mostly described as 'good news' in the third person rather than directly bestowed.

voorbeelden: I order you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her (quoted).
Believe on the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved (quoted).
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher quotes the authority of Paul/Scripture but rarely speaks with direct apostolic authority to the congregation.

indicatoren: Extensive retelling of the Acts narrative.
Theological explanation of what the text 'represents'.
Use of 'we learn' and 'the narrative says'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a biblical drama rather than a participant in a current event.

missende_elementen: Direct promise ('I promise you in God's name')
Direct address of the Spirit's current action

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Indirect; framed as 'the good news is that...'
voorbeelden: The good news is that the crucified/risen one lets us be our true selves.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's perspective and 'we' inclusive of the church.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used late in the sermon to bridge the text to the listener ('your life').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Conditional ('If any of this comes close...')

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode; describing Paul, the girl, the jailer, and 'the church'.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (The story) to a soft Directive/Appeal (He had to decide... So do we all).
voorbeelden: He had to decide afresh and unafraid. So do we all.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'event' is left to the human will (decision) rather than the divine word (declaration).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Lacks a strong Declarative center that changes the hearer's status before the final appeal.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: So do we all [have to decide].

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant thematic exposition of the text but functions more as a lecture on the 'power of Jesus' than an exercise of that power upon the listener.

sterke_punten.effect: Provides a strong intellectual framework for the liturgical season.

zwakke_punten.probleem: Talking about the good news instead of delivering it.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It describes an event (the earthquake/exorcism) but does not quite become one.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The language remains descriptive (constative) rather than creative (declarative).

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the past narrative, but the preacher speaks as a commentator on that narrative.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Moderate; speaks on behalf of the 'church' and 'lectionary'.
tekstueel_bewijs: In my church in the UCC...

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as a theme of Pentecost.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the 'yearning' of the hearer.
tekstueel_bewijs: unless there is a hope and a yearning

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon points to baptism as the means of grace, but doesn't fully function as one itself.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Limited to the quotes of Psalm 97.
tekstueel_bewijs: That is what baptism is about...

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is/was' verbs; needs more 'I [God] promise' or 'You are' verbs.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The good news is that the crucified/risen one lets us be our true selves.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, the risen Christ sets you free to be your true self.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth to a present-tense address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are buried in narrative descriptions.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who are anxious: Jesus commands your possessing spirits to leave.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The 'You' only appears in the final third.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the 'You' into the retelling of the Acts episodes.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are that jailer, waking up to the shaking of your own foundations.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The final 'decision' feels like a human work.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Base the decision on the already-declared freedom.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is homiletically sophisticated but would gain 'event-character' by shifting from describing the power of Jesus to exercising it through the spoken word.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal'; SAT focuses on whether the words actually perform the liberation they describe.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade the hearer to decide; SAT seeks to change the hearer's reality by God's authority.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon 'talks about' joy and freedom more than it 'bestows' them.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The good news is that the crucified/risen one lets us be our true selves.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies on the 'strangeness' of the text to do the work, but the illocutionary force remains largely constative.
